# SCNPhysicsFieldScope

**Enumeration**

Options for defining the region of space affected by a physics field, used by the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsField/scope] property.

## Declaration

```swift
enum SCNPhysicsFieldScope
```

## Overview

You define a region of space for a field using the position of the node containing the field and the field’s [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsField/halfExtent] and [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsField/usesEllipsoidalExtent] properties. Then, you use the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsField/scope] property to choose whether the field’s area of effect is the interior of this region or whether it is the entirety of scene space excluding this region.

## Constants

- **SCNPhysicsFieldScope.insideExtent**: The field’s effect applies only to objects within the region of space defined by its position and extent.
- **SCNPhysicsFieldScope.outsideExtent**: The field’s effect applies only to objects outside the region of space defined by its position and extent.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Constants

- **SCNFieldForceEvaluator**: The signature for a block that SceneKit calls to determine the effect of a custom field on an object.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
